citing_paper_authors: Matthias, Hartung | Anette, Frank
raw_text: Compositionality of adjective-noun phrases and how it can be adequately modeled in VSMs is the main concern in Baroni and Zamparelli (2010) and Guevara (2010), who are in search of the best composition operator for combining adjective with noun meanings
clean_text: Compositionality of adjective-noun phrases and how it can be adequately modeled in VSMs is the main concern in Baroni and Zamparelli (2010) and Guevara (2010), who are in search of the best composition operator for combining adjective with noun meanings.

citing_paper_authors: Eva Maria, Vecchi | Marco, Baroni | Roberto, Zamparelli
raw_text: We evaluate four different com positionality models shown to have various levels of success in representing the meaning of AN pairs: the simple additive and multiplicative models of Mitchell and Lapata (2008), and the linear-map-based models of Guevara (2010) and Baroni and Zamparelli (2010)
clean_text: We evaluate four different compositionality models shown to have various levels of success in representing the meaning of AN pairs: the simple additive and multiplicative models of Mitchell and Lapata (2008), and the linear-map-based models of Guevara (2010) and Baroni and Zamparelli (2010).

citing_paper_authors: Eva Maria, Vecchi | Marco, Baroni | Roberto, Zamparelli
raw_text: The final approach we re-implement is the one proposed by Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), who treat attributive adjectives as functions from noun meanings to noun meanings
clean_text: The final approach we re-implement is the one proposed by Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), who treat attributive adjectives as functions from noun meanings to noun meanings.

citing_paper_authors: Eva Maria, Vecchi | Marco, Baroni | Roberto, Zamparelli
raw_text: Baroni and Zamparelli (2010) show that their model significantly outperforms other vector composition methods, including addition, multiplication and Guevara? s approach ,inthe task of approximating the correct vectors for previously unseen (but corpus-attested) ANs
clean_text: Baroni and Zamparelli (2010) show that their model significantly outperforms other vector composition methods, including addition, multiplication and Guevara's approach, in the task of approximating the correct vectors for previously unseen (but corpus-attested) ANs.

citing_paper_authors: Eva Maria, Vecchi | Marco, Baroni | Roberto, Zamparelli
raw_text: Note that they follow very closely the procedure of Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), including choices of source corpus and parameter values, so that we expect their results on the quality of the various models in predicting ANs to also hold for our re-implementations
clean_text: Note that they follow very closely the procedure of Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), including choices of source corpus and parameter values, so that we expect their results on the quality of the various models in predicting ANs to also hold for our re-implementations.

citing_paper_authors: Eva Maria, Vecchi | Marco, Baroni | Roberto, Zamparelli
raw_text: Confirming the results of Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), non-normalized versions of add and mult were also tested, but did not produce significant results (in the case of multiplication, normalization amounts to multiplying the composite vector by a scalar, so it only affects the length-dependent vector length measure)
clean_text: Confirming the results of Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), non-normalized versions of add and mult were also tested, but did not produce significant results (in the case of multiplication, normalization amounts to multiplying the composite vector by a scalar, so it only affects the length-dependent vector length measure).

citing_paper_authors: Eva Maria, Vecchi | Marco, Baroni | Roberto, Zamparelli
raw_text: It is important to note that, as reported in Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), the mult method canbe expected to perform better in the original, non reduced semantic space because the SVD dimensions can have negative values, leading to counter intuitive results with component-wise multiplication (multiplying large opposite-sign values results in large negative values instead of being cancelled out)
clean_text: It is important to note that, as reported in Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), the mult method can be expected to perform better in the original, non reduced semantic space because the SVD dimensions can have negative values, leading to counter intuitive results with component-wise multiplication (multiplying large opposite-sign values results in large negative values instead of being cancelled out).

citing_paper_authors: Eva Maria, Vecchi | Marco, Baroni | Roberto, Zamparelli
raw_text: Following Guevara ,weestimate the coefficients of the equation using (multivariate) partial least squares regression (PLSR) as implemented in the Rpls package (MevikandWehrens, 2007), with the latent dimension parameter of PLSR set to 50, the same value used by Baroni and Zamparelli (2010)
clean_text: Following Guevara, we estimate the coefficients of the equation using (multivariate) partial least squares regression (PLSR) as implemented in the Rpls package (MevikandWehrens, 2007), with the latent dimension parameter of PLSR set to 50, the same value used by Baroni and Zamparelli (2010).

raw_text: Finally, in the adjective-specific linear map (alm) method of Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), an AN is generated by multiplying an adjective weight matrix with a noun vector
clean_text: Finally, in the adjective-specific linear map (alm) method of Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), an AN is generated by multiplying an adjective weight matrix with a noun vector.

citing_paper_authors: Eva Maria, Vecchi | Marco, Baroni | Roberto, Zamparelli
raw_text: In Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), the alm model performed far better than add and mult in approximating the correct vectors for unseen ANs, while on this (in a sense, more meta linguistic) task add and mult work better, while alm is successful only in the more sophisticated measure of neighbor density. The lack of significant results for the cosine measure is disappointing, but not entirely surprising
clean_text: In Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), the alm model performed far better than add and mult in approximating the correct vectors for unseen ANs, while on this (in a sense, more meta linguistic) task add and mult work better, while alm is successful only in the more sophisticated measure of neighbor density.

clean_text: Although, somewhat disappointingly, the model that has been shown in a previous study (Baroni and Zamparelli, 2010) to be the best at capturing the semantics of well-formed ANs turns out to be worse than simple addition and multiplication.

citing_paper_authors: Louise, McNally | Miquel, Cornudella | Gemma, Boleda | Eva Maria, Vecchi
raw_text: Interestingly, recent approaches to the semantic composition of adjectives with nouns such as Baroni and Zamparelli (2010) and Guevara (2010) draw onthe classical analysis of adjectives within the Montagovian tradition of formal semantic theory (Montague, 1974), on which they are treated as higher order predicates, and model adjectives as matrices of weights that are applied to noun vectors
clean_text: Interestingly, recent approaches to the semantic composition of adjectives with nouns such as Baroni and Zamparelli (2010) and Guevara (2010) draw on the classical analysis of adjectives within the Montagovian tradition of formal semantic theory (Montague, 1974), on which they are treated as higher order predicates, and model adjectives as matrices of weights that are applied to noun vectors.

clean_text: In the adjective-specific linear map (alm) model, proposed by Baroni and Zamparelli (2010), a different matrix B is learnt for each adjective.
